Frozen Planet II Plot summary

Frozen Planet II is chiefly about the present nature’s chronicles, which are meticulously explored and fluently articulated by the unrivaled master of narration, Sir David Frederick Attenborough. This six-part series format unearths the formidable wildlife in the inhospitable, thick glacial surroundings of the world’s icy-cold regions within the Arctic and Antarctic boundaries.

Keeping body and soul together in that below-freezing temperature, Sir Attenborough voices the startling challenges that the diverse inhabitant species of that area have to endure in order to protect their generation from going completely extinct.

In this petrifying journey, the documentary fathoms the most savage local animals (including the Siberian tigers, the snow monkeys, the grizzly bears, the Emperor penguins, and others) and their dreadful metaphors that are creating calamities for all the lives on planet Earth.
